intro: Remijia trianae, commonly known as the Trianas' remijia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a distinctive pubescent surface. Remijia trianae is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at higher elevations.
